title.narrative: ADOLESCENTS MULTISECTOR COORDINATION

description.narrative: By 2020, multisector coordination on adolescent-sensitive issues, evidence-based policies and strategies, with a focus on HIV/AIDS, are in place,which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Hiv Prevention, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, adolescents, particularly girls, their families and communities adopt key healthy and protective behaviours and are engaged in the development process.

sector.narrative: Adolescent participation data/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Adolescents participating in or leading civic engagement initiatives (including in humanitarian settings)
Children, adolescent and youth engagement and participation
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
Support Policy and guidance developments and address barriers to accessing HIV services by adolescents including gender mainstreaming
Technical assistance - Cross-sectoral communication for development

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, multisector coordination on adolescent-sensitive issues, evidence-based policies and strategies, with a focus on HIV/AIDS, are in place

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF continued to support the government-led adolescent multi-sectoral coordination mechanisms to ensure collaboration and synergies on Adolescent Sexual and Reproductive Health (ASRH), Child Marriage and Gender-based violence (GBV) whilst continuing to encourage adolescent engagement and empowerment. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2020

title.narrative: Percentage of districts are implementing at least 3 high impact adolescent HIV prevention interventions
Adolescents aged 15-19 years having knowledge about HIV sexual transmission
Supporting implementation of at least three high-impact gender-responsive adolescent prevention intervention
UN-Inter-Agency Network for Youth Development (UN-IANYD) established with UNICEF contribution and functional

actual.value: 2019:UN-IANYD exists but was is not 100%operational in 2019. Emergency response to IDAI and Kenneth mobilized most partners for several months. Main ASRH coordination mechanism remains PGB and Rapariga Biz and CNCS for HIV although with endorsement of School health Strategy this may change in 2020.

title.narrative: Adolescent-led situation analysis, with focus on child participation, developed and disseminated

actual.value: 2020:Adolescent SiTAN disseminated by adolescent themselves in several public fora to influence programming such as VAC in Schools reporting mechanism planning meeting and UNICEF Annual Review. In 2020, adolescents will present at National PGB Meeting.
